At about 10 am eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @EdwardLawrence on @FoxNews Channel.

In this @cheddar TV interview with @KenBuffa I discuss the omicron #COVID19 variant and how travel bans — that punish countries for being transparent about variants —  are not the action of choice and should be lifted immediately https://t.co/s82KW0hPBt
At about 9 am eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @smerconish on @CNN
At about 2:20 PM eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @KenBuffa on @cheddar TV. Watch live here https://t.co/7BbCdOEoRv

In @NateWeixel’s piece, I’m quoted (alongside awesome @DrPaulOffit) that it’s wrong to change definitions of fully #COVID19 vaccinated based on boosters ‘The 3rd dose is "a detour away from what's really important, which is vaccinating the unvaccinated’” https://t.co/AoI8GAuIqH

In this @petersullivan4 piece I am quoted about how #COVID19 will find and infect unvaccinated and/or non-immune populations and vaccinations — 1st and 2nd doses — are the key intervention https://t.co/jlXxAC5iK0
At about 11 AM eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @GarrettHaake on @NBCNewsNow. Watch live here https://t.co/iT5S3RNkHl
Travel restrictions are not justified and unjustly penalize countries for sharing data about #COVID19 variant identification. https://t.co/k6eeRG3drH

Very interesting interview of @mattwridley by @yaronbrook on the #covid19 origins. No matter what the answer ultimately is, transparency is needed because both lab leak and animal spillover have critical implications for pandemic preparedness in the future https://t.co/mFERU2atRg
At about 9:12 am eastern I’ll be discussi the latest on #COVID19 with @SeanaNSmith and @SPYJared on @YahooFinance. Watch live here https://t.co/KQQ714BVhD
In this tv interview with @amy_hudak I discuss how I expect #COVID19 cases to rise in the coming weeks and, and for the non-immune, infection is likely inevitable https://t.co/RAoFzDoUTk
In this podcast/radio interview with @DrMarcSiegel I discuss multiple aspects of #COVID19, including boosters and antivirals https://t.co/v2JYCckM8W
“Is that world better off with or without high-containment biolabs?…without them, we would lack all sorts of treatments for diseases like Covid-19 and Ebola” https://t.co/DpJyPCm4Mr

“There may never be the kind of definitive end to Covid19 that we all crave, no decisive before-and-after moment..we’ve been gradually but steadily redesigning the world in response to this crisis.. our world will be full of these changes” https://t.co/QW1Wn7cVwR

“pandemics as a basic fact of life..maybe, if the science unleashed by this pandemic lives up to its promise, his children — or perhaps his grandchildren — could inherit a world where plagues are a thing of the past” https://t.co/PnxL3PQU1e

“‘We’re really not very good at forecasting right now. The horizon is just a few weeks and even that is challenging’..scientists can forecast repeating outbreaks like..flu..pandemics are a different beast..occur far less frequently, and each 1 is distinct” https://t.co/K4tNb1MKeF

In this television interview with @kylieWTAE I discuss how a good way to keep #COVID19 risk to a minimum during Thanksgiving is having non-immune individuals do rapid home tests just prior to the gathering https://t.co/VxRWbL0FVO

“Unfortunately, increasing the number of Americans who are fully vaccinated is likely to be a slow process. Making reliable Covid-19 testing more widely available and better reported can help in the interim.” https://t.co/AW6BWCAq74

In this @rachel_roubein piece I’m quoted about the fact that Thanksgiving 2021 is different from 2020 in that many many high risk people are now vaccinated against #covid19. That should influence risk tolerance and calculation https://t.co/hDfXPkb7z5

In this piece I’m quoted about the value of home #COVID19 testing to determine contagiousness and risk which is extremely valuable when unvaccinated individuals are interacting with each other https://t.co/l8SNEfBd8L

Rural or not, healthcare workers should be required to be vaccinated against #COVID19 and #influenza as a condition of employment. It is not right to excuse rural hospital administrators who fear their staff so don’t lead on this issue  https://t.co/3O2dDumEOE
At about 11:45 AM eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @jdbalart on @MSNBC

In this TV interview with @sperrineWTAE I discuss #COVID19 booster vaccine doses. The benefits clear in high risk individuals, but less so in healthy people where they may be transient and just pushing an inevitable breakthrough infection into the future https://t.co/0aHXUNYjAP
At about 9:10 am eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 on Bloomberg @Quicktake. Watch live beee https://t.co/fSusZRJQSb
At about 3 pm I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 @DrMarcSiegel on @NYUDocs on Sirius/XM channel 110

In this @kdkaradio interview with @ManginoOnKDKAAM I discuss #COVID19 and Thanksgiving. For the fully vaccinated, it is not a big deal and should proceed normally. The risk is when unvaccinated high risk individuals gather indoors https://t.co/rSU9Ax3xdI

In this TV interview with @tomkeene @kaileyleinz I discuss how #COVID19 antivirals should not be thought of as substitutes for vaccines and how prevention is always better than treatment. https://t.co/Dv51W4ewV2

Brown’s pandemic preparedness expertise just rocketed to the highest echelon with @JenniferNuzzo joining them. A loss for Hopkins but I am 1000% sure her scholarship, analysis, and leadership will continue to benefit the country and the world https://t.co/va18LMxmQD
In this @AaronBlake piece I am quoted about the fact that #COVID19 vaccinated people are much less likely to be sources of infection for myriad reasons https://t.co/hnCXorvaLQ

In this @priyanka_runwal piece I am quoted about the life-saving value of fetal cell lines in biomedical research. They have been widely used in the development of many medications (not just #covid19 vaccines) and human lives are improved by it https://t.co/Czf3vCJy3Z

In this @sciam piece I write about the promise of #COVID19 antivirals and how it doesn’t diminish the importance of vaccination. They are complementary to each other, not substitutes https://t.co/dcoGTvfhfz
At about 7:16 am eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 @joefryer on @NBCNewsNow. Watch live here https://t.co/iT5S3RNkHl
At about 6:40 am eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @MorningsMaria on @FoxBusiness Network
In this piece I am quoted about #COVID19 and what the goals are regarding boosters for the healthy. I think this needs to be articulated a lot better https://t.co/ewTtWhGdNb

In this @ChrisMegerian piece I’m quoted about broadening booster recommendations and #COVID19. I don’t think booster doses will solve the hospital capacity concerns or greatly change the trajectory of the pandemic — that is what 1st and 2nd shots do https://t.co/kxeyQXLmwv
At about 2:50 pm eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 on @KDKARadio with @ManginoOnKDKAAM. Listen live here https://t.co/tvdwdUlGWS

In this television interview with @AlecHaimPollard I discuss #COVID19 booster vaccine recommendations. The priority should be on the high risk groups, even with widened availability. https://t.co/fQ0KGkxJIO
In this episode of th @StartHereABC podcast, I discuss various aspects of #COVID19 boosters with @TheBradMielke including in whom they are most impactful (8:17 mark) https://t.co/Kfb77C18Ql

In this @jeffdalessio piece I am quoted about the best case scenario for #COVID19 — I think that is the taming of the virus through vaccinations, antivirals, monoclonal antibodies, rapid diagnostics and better in hospital treatment https://t.co/mO3bsiGtF1

In this TV interview with @vladduthiersCBS and @AMGreenCBS I discuss booster #COVID19 vaccinations. I don’t think it’s a good state of affairs when more boosters are being administered than 1st doses. It’s 1st and 2nd doses that are most critical https://t.co/7h9NXrydMP
In this interview with @nikos_17 and @MarkRPellegrino for @aynrandcentre I discuss various aspects of #COVID19 policy, vaccines, antivirals, and other topics https://t.co/w6OawNRsV8

In this piece I am quoted about how #COVID19 is becoming a much tamer disease because of scientific advances that have rendered it vaccine preventable, rapidly diagnosable, and treatable https://t.co/rBCKtreInA

In this @dpfunke piece I am quoted about how #COVID19 vaccines decrease transmission. Those who are vaccinated and develop breakthrough infections are much less contagious than those who are unvaccinated and infected. https://t.co/NUGR6mb5IS
At about 1 PM eastern I will be discussing #COVID19 and Europe’s approach and return to lockdowns with @Nikos_17 and @MarkRPellegrino for @aynrandcentre. Watch live here: https://t.co/pLlAyhTpFs
“community and social support that was lost during the pandemic, along with the closing of schools, contributed to the death toll” https://t.co/Vd8baGxDdS
